content.description: Starts the same as Lock and Key then traverses the middle of the boulder topping out on the right side. If you use the large block on the lower right the grade drops to V4ish.
content.location: Starts just like Lock and Key on the left side then at the jug where Lock and Key heads up keep going right and stay low to some pumpy moves and a big gaston. Finish with a mantle out right.

content.description: Go up large blocky ledges and jugs to a positive slopey top out.
Starting in a roof crack at the back of the cave head up the center of the boulder.
content.location: Starts at the back of the overhang in a large roof crack and decent foot to the left.

content.description: Follow the "Scales" to the top via a series of cracks.
content.location: Just to the left of Lock and Key and to the right of Crystal Rails

content.description: Super fun Bat Hang problem. Start with your feet tucked into a large triangle shaped jug. For your left hand there’s a good crimp, and the right fits nicely onto a slopey knob. Flip yourself around and go straight up and over!
Start on the flake to the right. Gaston to the left then go straight up on the small roof jugs. Mantle on the rail. The crux is the Gaston.
content.location: The route is on the far right of the boulder.

content.description: Start to the right of Lock and Key in a small pocket moving up and straight through the block with some nice body tension to the same jug as Lock and Key and topout.
content.location: Just to the right of Lock and Key look for the small pocket

content.description: Starting on the left between the flat left side and the overhang trend up and right via rail pockets to a big jug then pull the roof to topout.
content.location: Where the flat face meets the overhang

content.description: The Sundrop Boulder has many problems on it. For this V4-, you need to start on matched low jugs to the left. Use a left heel hook and don't touch the lower pedestal because it is off. Move out to a nice 4 finger hold with a thumb to hold onto. Move out right with a 3 finger crimp slot. After moving up with the right hand to a nice hold, the crux is to slap up into a jug. The rest of the moves are V-easy.
Step up on a small ledge and into some friction and rails. Work your way up to a decent crystal jug to topout
content.location: To the right of V-easy terrain and just left of Scales. There is a small quartz line to the center/left of the problem.

content.description: Starting on two edge holds and a block on the right, head left to the center jug and make a couple big moves followed by a mantle finish
content.location: Right side of the boulder just above the block ledge.

content.description: Start on right pedestal and work out till you can mantle up with the good pinch and ledges. Finish top right of the boulder.
One of the last boulders on the trail right near a trail junction. Flat left side with some low grade crack/friction problems and some fun overhang problems to the right.
